_id.description: Unique identifier for the task. Generated automatically by TheHive using the format '~<number>'.

_type.description: Entity type identifier. Always 'Task' for task objects.

_createdBy.description: Email or username of the user who created this task.

_updatedBy.description: Email or username of the user who last updated this task.

_createdAt.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds since Unix epoch) when the task was created.

_updatedAt.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds since Unix epoch) when the task was last updated.

title.description: The task title or name. Brief description of what action needs to be performed.

group.description: Task group name used to organize tasks within a case. Tasks with the same group are displayed together. Default group is 'default'.

description.description: Detailed description of the task, including instructions, context, or requirements for completion.

status.description: Current status of the task. Hard-coded statuses that cannot be modified or extended. 'Waiting' = not started, 'InProgress' = actively worked on, 'Completed' = finished (mandatory tasks require at least one task log), 'Cancel' = cancelled/abandoned.

flag.description: Whether this task is flagged for attention. Flagged tasks are highlighted in the task list for visibility across the organization.

startDate.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds) when work on this task began. Can be set manually or automatically when status changes to 'InProgress'.

endDate.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds) when the task was completed or cancelled. Set when status changes to 'Completed' or 'Cancel'.

assignee.description: Email or username of the user assigned to work on this task. Tasks can be assigned to users within the organization.

order.description: Sort order of the task within its group. Lower numbers appear first. Used to control display order in task lists.

dueDate.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds) when the task is due to be completed. Used for deadline tracking and task prioritization.

mandatory.description: Whether this task must be completed before the case can be closed. Mandatory tasks require at least one task log to be marked as 'Completed'.

extraData.description: Optional fields that can be requested via the 'extraData' query parameter. These fields are not returned by default due to performance overhead. Request specific fields by adding 'extraData: ["fieldName"]' to the page operation in your query.

case.description: The parent case object containing this task. Includes all case fields like title, description, status, severity, etc. Useful for accessing case context without a separate query.

caseId.description: The numeric case ID of the parent case.

caseTemplate.description: The case template object that was used to create the parent case (if any). Includes template name, tasks, and configuration.

caseTemplateId.description: The unique identifier of the case template used to create the parent case. Returns null if the case was not created from a template.

isOwner.description: Whether the current user is the owner of this task. Used to control UI elements and determine edit/delete permissions.

shareCount.description: Total number of organizations this task has been shared with. Used for quick visibility in task lists without fetching full share details.

actionRequired.description: Whether an action is required from the current user's organization on this task. Introduced in TheHive 4.0.3 for collaborative workflows. When true, the task displays a 'Require Action' indicator.

actionRequiredMap.description: Map of organization IDs to boolean values indicating whether an action is required from each shared organization. Provides detailed view of which organizations need to take action on this task.

additionalQueries.description: Holds results of additional queries requested via the 'additionalQueries' parameter in the search API. Each key corresponds to a named query and contains its result set.

task-logs.description: Array of task log objects associated with this task. Each log contains details like log message, author, timestamp, etc.
